description: Scots pernickety, persnickety, of uncertain origin; the Dictionary of the Scots Language says that it resembles per- (“intensifying prefix”) + nick, but might be derived from particular + finicky with the form influenced by past participles ending in -et, -it, -ed.

adjectives.description: pernickety (comparative more pernickety, superlative most pernickety)

entries.meaning: (chiefly Britain) Fussy; paying undue attention to minor details; fastidious.
examples: Synonyms: niggly, (US) persnickety; see also Thesaurus:fastidious
